alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of eastern Rockingham, northwestern Caswell and southeastern Pittsylvania Counties and the City of Danville through 1045 PM EDT... At 1021 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along Highway 29 between Reidsville, North Carolina, and Chatham, Virginia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect ponding of water on the road and poor drainage flooding. Areas which received heavy rain during the afternoon, may experience a quicker response to rising water. Locations impacted include... Danville... Reidsville... Bethel... Providence... Mayfield... Blairs... and Quick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Do not drive through water that covers the road, especially at night when it is harder to see the road. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. For your safety, seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
